long_description:
Effective and successful meetings pave the way for new ventures and rewarding business relationships. Taking a meeting outside the office not only levels the playing field, but also gives you a much needed mental break from emails, phone calls and constant interruptions.

 

Next time you’re planning to host a lunch meeting, make your reservation at Forty Four Restaurant in Royalton New York Hotel to taste our brand new Power Lunch Menu. With an intimate atmosphere, business lunches flow smoothly and our service is prompt to give you plenty of time to eat and discuss how to rule the world.

 

Based on our expertise attending to corporate clients, we wish to share our pointers on how to have a productive Manhattanite Power Lunch in 45 minutes.

 

Establish a Clear Purpose for the Meeting  

Whether you’re meeting with potential colleagues or that-hard-to-get client, as you invite them to join you for lunch, be clear on the objective of the meeting and what results you want from it. This way, all participants will know what to expect and you won’t catch anyone off-guard.

Remember that heading out with a specific purpose in mind will give you confidence and show your leadership skills.

 

Prepare an Agenda

Put together an outline of the topics that will be discussed to stay on topic. Although handouts are a good option in a conference room, they are impractical during a meal. Avoid the embarrassment of spilling sauce on a handout!

Sending the agenda in advance will also help you to avoid drifting off-topic and manage time effectively. And speaking of time management...

 

Run Like a Swiss Watch

Be the boss. Arrive early, start on time and finish on time. Most of us don’t have more than an hour or so for lunch and respecting your client or colleagues’ time will speak highly of you.

Contact Royalton New York to make a reservation at Forty Four and ensure that your table is ready for you when you arrive. If you’re planning on a 45-minute lunch, try to limit the actual meeting to 20-30 minutes.

 

Show How Much You Care

Any communications expert will insist that body language matters. Silence your phone and don’t lay it on the table to avoid unnecessary distractions.

Making eye contact and listening attentively will show your client or colleagues that you’re interested in forming a real bond. Business culture revolves around a table. Part of sharing a meal involves relaxing a little and getting to know each other outside a formal sit-down meeting.

And you may not want to admit it, but your parents were right: table manners matter, otherwise you’ll risk distracting the participants with that piece of food rolling around in your mouth. No.

 

Once you’ve had a taste of the good life at the Royalton, you’ll want to come back for more. Apart from serving the corporate lunch crowd, the Royalton New York offers penthouses ideal for private meetings or venues available for private events. Contact us to request a proposal or ask about our offers.
title: How to Have a Productive Power Lunch in 45 Minutes
